posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
Hi all

What is the best character at "fishing for 20s" in melee fights? Say an endgame boss has 200 AC (even when flat-footed) and is spell immune. She also dwells in a very tight room where you can't snipe her or set up traps. How do you build your level 40 character in order to defeat her? It should be somewhat playable 1-40 and retain honest AC and/or HP, as the boss will also try to hit you. Let's say +5 environment. 
I can think of several ways to boost your average damage output on lucky 20s, but what's the most effective combination?
  • Improved Power Attack
  • EWS
  • Buffs (GMW, Divine Favor, Flame Weapon etc)
  • High STR (RDD? Dragon Shape?)
  • Many attacks (twin kama Monk? Flurry does not work with IPA I think)
  • Sneak attacks (you can have at most 4/round, correct?)
  • Ranger feats
  • Divine Might
  • Using a two-handed weapon
  • Bard song
  • Divine Wrath
I probably forgot several things. Remember, AB is irrelevant, so one can be creative. Like two bastard swords with no need to take Ambidexterity.
What would you do?

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
Monk "woodpecker" with 10 attacks/round.
I don't think this is the way. Unless you have a build in mind that deals more than 90 damage per hit, Improved Power Attack is better than Flurry of Blows and so 9 attacks trumps 10.

That would probably be the answer, doesn't count :)
Elemental damage is fine by me, but it has to be delivered by the weapon.

I just drafted a dual-wielding Cleric/Bard/RDD that is better than a Monk unless the Monk can deal more than ~33 damage/hit, which is definitely doable. STR-based Monk/Fighter/Ranger maybe? Monk/Cleric/X?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Without performing an actual damage calc I'd guess that a Rang23/Cler16/Monk1 probably out-damages most other builds against this specific mob. Making it playable is asking for too much though, you can either minmax for damage or make it playable.

This is assuming that the mob doesn't have concealment, DI/DR, or Epic Dodge. If it has any defensive abilities other than high AC then my recommendation might change.

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
I was doing some calculations, and I think you are spot-on, Yunim. STR-based Ranger23/Cleric16/Monk1 (with BoE, Divine Might and IPA) gets up to 500 dmg/round vs 0 AC, or 25 dmg/round against our hypothetical enemy. By contrast, Cleric/Bard/RDD and Cleric/Druid/Monk get around 400. I'll try to concoct a playable build based on this idea.

Out of curiosity, what would change if you took concealment into account? I think I can see what effect DR/DI would have (builds with fewer, stronger attacks are better), and Epic Dodge would mean that more attacks are better.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Some of the more extreme min-maxed DPS builds I've made sacrifice Blind Fight for more damage. If your target has concealment then the extra damage probably isn't worth dropping Blind Fight. The Rang23/Cler16/Monk1 can fit in Blind Fight since it doesn't need IC: Kama, but other min-maxed builds might not have enough feats to spare.

DI/DR mainly affects weapon choice and the amount of unblockable damage that you should aim for. If the boss has 50% Pie DI and 50% Sla DI but no Blu DI then a 9 APR kama build might be outdamaged by a 7 APR dire mace build. If the boss has 50% DI to all damage types then going CHA focused with Divine Might is probably better than going STR focused for more physical damage.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: I think ScV, ED, and a high AC are worth considering just for staying alive long enough in that small room.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I did a quick damage calc and it seems that a human Rang21/Cler18/Monk1 with 30STR/18CHA is probably the best you can do without Sneak Attack. When using IPA it does a whopping 33.9 average damage per round (32.7 with FoB), much higher than the measly 33.4 average damage per round (32.2 with FoB) that a Rang23/Cler16/Monk1 does. This might change depending on the defensive abilities of the mob though, for the reasons stated above.

It only has 3 FE races but it should out-damage almost all other builds against this specific mob, provided that it's one of your FEs. It can heal and cast Improved Invisibility too, so the survivability shouldn't be too bad (for a DPS build anyway).

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
A min-maxed Rang23/Pal16/Monk1 would have either +2STR or +2CHA compared to a min-maxed Rang21/Cler18/Monk1. So the Cleric version would still do the most damage since it's 1d6 +11 vs 1d6 +4. If the mob had lower (but still high) AC then things might be different, since Darkfire isn't affected by critical hits and so Holy Sword could potentially out-damage Darkfire. However for this specific mob the cleric version is better, since critical hits don't matter.

Without knowing what the DI/DR actually is there's no way to adjust for them so it's best to just assume the mob doesn't have any. As I've said in previous comments, if it does have any defensive abilities other than high AC then my answer for best DPS build might change.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Actually it is possible to do better than 18STR/30CHA, I was starting with balanced ability scores so the damage is slightly lower.

Rang21/Cler18/Monk1 has BoE and G STR/CHA 6 for it's epic feats, Rang23/Cler16/Monk1 has G STR/CHA 7 for it's epic feats. Rang21/Cler18/Monk1 gets 1 more damage from Darkfire compared to a Rang23/Cler16/Monk1, so the potential +2 STR/CHA of a Rang23/Cler16/Monk1 is offset by that.

Human is the best race, since the build needs a minimum of 13 STR, 15 WIS, and 13 CHA, plus it focuses on STR/CHA so Half Orc won't work.

A balanced starting ability spread would be 16STR/8DEX/8CON/16WIS/8INT/16CHA, which can end at 16STR/32CHA. If you want more CHA then you can either get 15STR/8DEX/9CON/15WIS/8INT/17CHA or 14STR/8DEX/8CON/15WIS/8INT/18CHA. Both spreads need 6 G STR/CHA feats, to end at either 16STR/32CHA or 14STR/34CHA respectively.
Going from 16STR/32CHA to 18STR/30CHA results in the same damage but +1 AB, so the ending ability spreads are either 18STR/30CHA or 14STR/34CHA. 14STR/34CHA has +1 damage on it's OffHand Attacks.

So the most min-maxed version would be a human Rang21/Cler18/Monk1 with starting abilities of 14STR/8DEX/8CON/15WIS/8INT/18CHA, ending at 14STR/34CHA.
